page.title: 03FARMING IN THE VILLAGE(CONT)
page.content: {Welsh Blacks}and the area N.E. of the {Chuch,Cookshill}also owned by{Stowell {Park}is mainly arable and dense woodland with some grazing for sheep. {Ballingers Farm}has a small acreage and some sheep but the owner mainly subcontracts machinery to other farmers. {Woodland Farm}lies on the outskirts of the village and{Denfurlong}is near the{Hemplands.}The farmer owns many acres of arable land and dense woodland.He has two large herds of Friesians with a wonderful milking parlour designed by the farmer himself.He allows parties of children to visit the farm and lands and many come from schools a great distance away.He has devised a 'farm trail' so that children can see the different crops grown in the fields. BY IAN GOODALL SARAH COSGROVE
